parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> 1.75

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets ability level of person (commander unit). Value of skill may vary from 0 to 1.<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma1</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part></template> The alternative syntax allows fine-tuning [[AI Sub-skills]].<br>
Available sub-skills are:
* aimingAccuracy
* aimingShake
* aimingSpeed
* endurance
* spotDistance
* spotTime
* courage
* reloadSpeed
* commanding
* general
The value of a [[AI Sub-skills|sub-skill]] is interpolated into a range defined in [[CfgAISkill]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit [[setSkill]] skill

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> skill: [[Number]] in 0..1 range

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> unit [[setSkill]] [skillName, value]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> skillName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] in 0..1 range

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_hero [[setSkill]] 1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_finalBoss [[setSkill]] ["reloadSpeed", 0.8]; _finalBoss [[setSkill]] ["aimingSpeed", 0.33];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[skill]], [[setUnitAbility]], [[Arma 3 AI Skill]], [[ArmA: AI Combat Modes|AI Combat Modes]], [[skillFinal]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2006 - 12:01</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Approximate ranges are:
* Novice < 0.25
* Rookie >= 0.25 and <= 0.45
* Recruit > 0.45 and <= 0.65
* Veteran > 0.65 and <= 0.85
* Expert > 0.85


<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 30, 2007 - 21:16</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
If "SuperAI" is turned on in the Difficulty Menu, the skill level is always 1, no matter what was defined in the editor or via this command.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
